TopicTitle: Rules of thumb for plane altitude on Kerbin

Articles.Content:
If you're flying at night (which is pretty common if you don't want to wait until the next morning to launch your mission, or your flight goes half way around the globe) here's some "safe altitude guidelines" for Kerbin:
Ocean: I recommend 300.  I didn't like lower because of the wave you will cause behind you, particularly at near-supersonic speeds and above (kudos to Squad for this effect).
Ice shelves, Shores: 500 (Note: Kerbin's Ice Shelves are PERFECTLY flat.)
Tundra, Desert, Badlands, and Grasslands: 1000
Ice Caps: 2000
Highlands: 3000
Mountains: 5000
